title: Belief Systems Project
descriptions:
The following abstract is proposed for the Belief Systems Project grant application:

Understanding democratic politics, extremism, and political decision-making is of paramount importance in today's complex and polarized world. However, current research suffers from flawed conceptualizations of belief systems, leading to a loss of interrelationships between beliefs. The Belief Systems Project aims to address these gaps by understanding the basic structure of belief systems as systems of interconnecting attitudes and values, employing network analyses as a novel approach.

Through this new approach, the project intends to advance our understanding of belief systems by mapping the structure of systems of attitudes and values, answering questions about central concepts and clustering, and modeling within-person belief systems and variations. Furthermore, we will test changes in belief systems due to external and internal pressures, which can significantly contribute to comprehending the dynamics of political belief systems over time, between countries, and within individuals.

The project will leverage various data sources, including survey data, longitudinal panel studies, intensive longitudinal designs, experiments, and text analyses to ensure comprehensive and robust findings. Ultimately, the Belief Systems Project aims to provide a more nuanced and accurate understanding of political belief systems, which can inform policies and actions that promote democratic stability and mitigate extremism.
